Container.Name: sabnzbd-extended
Container.Overview: SABnzbd makes Usenet as simple and streamlined as possible by automating everything we can. All you have to do is add an .nzb. SABnzbd takes over from there, where it will be automatically downloaded, verified, repaired, extracted and filed away with zero human interaction.[br] [br][br][b][span style='color: #E80000;']Important Paths:[/span][/u][/b] [b]/storage[/b] :: Root location for downloads, see additonal paths below [b]/storage/downloads/sabnzbd/incomplete[/b] :: Automatically created on setup [b]/storage/downloads/sabnzbd/complete[/b] :: Automatically created on setup [b]/config[/b] :: Location of SABnzbd aplication files [b]/config/scripts[/b] :: Location of SABnzbd post process script files (automatically mapped in SABnzbd) [b]/config/scripts/logs[/b] :: Location of SMA log files [b]/config/scripts/configs[/b] :: Location of SMA config files [br][br][b][span style='color: #E80000;']Important SABNzbd Categories:[/span][/u][/b] [b]lidarr[/b] :: Automatically configured to post process using [b]audio-pp.bash[/b] [b]radarr[/b] :: Automatically configured to post process using [b]video-pp.bash[/b] [b]sonarr[/b] :: Automatically configured to post process using [b]video-pp.bash[/b] [br][br][b][span style='color: #E80000;']Scripts/Files included:[/span][/u][/b] [b]audio-pp.bash[/b] :: Automatically clean up downloaded audio files and convert to standardized format if desired [b]video-pp.bash[/b] :: Verify incoming video files for required audio/subtitle languages and process with SMA if enabled [b]beets-config.yaml[/b] :: Beets matching configuration file [br][br][b][span style='color: #E80000;']Sickbeard MP4 Automater (SMA):[/span][/u][/b] [b]Config Files Location:[/b] /config/scripts/configs [b]autoProcess.ini[/b] :: config file for SMA [b]Log Files Location:[/b] /config/scripts/logs [b]sma.log[/b] :: Log file for SMA For more detailed Container.Description: SABnzbd-Extended: This continer includes SABnzbd along with a set of post-processing scripts to enhance your SABnzbd usage

Config.Name: Auto Update SABnzbd Extended Scripts
Config.Description: TRUE = enabled :: Update scripts from git on container start

Config.Name: Audio Post Processor: Target Format
Config.Description: FLAC or OPUS or MP3 or AAC or ALAC - converts lossless FLAC files to set format

Config.Name: Audio Post Processor: Target Format Bitrate
Config.Description: Set to desired bitrate when converting to OPUS/MP3/FDK-AAC/AAC format types

Config.Name: Audio Post Processor: Verify Downloaded Tracks
Config.Description: TRUE = ENABLED, Verifies FLAC/MP3 files for errors (fixes MP3's, deletes bad FLAC files)

Config.Name: Audio Post Processor: Detect Single File Albums
Config.Description: TRUE = ENABLED :: Detects single file albums and mark download as failed if detected

Config.Name: Audio Post Processor: Replaygain FLAC tagging
Config.Description: TRUE = ENABLED, adds replaygain tags for compatible players (FLAC ONLY)

Config.Name: Audio Post Processor: Beets Tagging
Config.Description: TRUE = ENABLED, processes files with beets

Config.Name: Audio Post Processor: Require Beets Tagging
Config.Description: true = enabled :: skips importing files that could not be matched using beets

Config.Name: Video Post Processor: Required Audio/Subtitle Language
Config.Description: Default: eng :: Set to required language (ISO 639-2 language code), if not found, will mark as failed

Config.Name: Video Post Processor: Process with MKV Cleaner
Config.Description: TRUE = Enabled :: Uses MKVToolNix to remove unwanted audio/subtitle streams and sets UND audio language based on Required Audio/Subtitle Language setting

Config.Name: Video Post Processor: Encode with Sickbeard MP4 Automator (SMA)
Config.Description: TRUE = Enabled :: Uses SMA to process incoming video files

Config.Name: SMA Update
Config.Description: TRUE = enabled :: Update SMA on container startup
